game_start: ^Come on Honey, let’s do this exercise.
^It’s such a lovely day out though, Bear. Can’t we just go for a walk?
^Dr. Wasserman said that we should do memory puzzles at least once a day. Now come on, let’s try at least one picture.
questions_start: ^Now where did we take this picture?

b: ^Sheesh, I don’t know what this is a picture of. How is this happening? Why can’t I recognize it? I’m so stupid!
^I think I’m starting to recognize it, but I’m going to ask one more question. I don’t want to embarrass myself by getting it wrong.
^That’s enough hints. Do you remember where we took this picture?

c-0: ^If I tell you that you’ll know it for sure! Let’s just say it’s one of the most famous buildings in Europe.
c-1: ^We went here for our 30th wedding anniversary. Our friends had told us it’s one of the most romantic cities in the world, and they were right!
c-2: ^We went to a cute bistro for dinner that night. We may have had one too many bottles of wine, and I’m pretty sure this was the night we tried frog legs. I hated them, but you liked them!

holdingKnot: ^Now where did we take this picture?
correctAnswer: ^That’s right, Paris! This was one of my favorite trips we took, even if I was too chicken to go to the top of the Eiffel Tower.
^I knew it! Okay, maybe my memory is still working pretty well.
incorrectAnswer: ^Nope, not there. This picture was taken in Paris, France. We took it almost 15 years ago.
^Why didn’t I know that? I know what the Eiffel Tower is. I was a geography teacher for crying out loud!
returing_after_finished: ^Alright Honey, why don't you pick another souvenier and we'll do the same thing.
